channel.title: 97 Things Every Programmer Should Know
channel.description:
Hey everyone, I've recently subscribed to a site called Safari Books Online. It's basically a digital library containing a plethora of technical and technological documents. Things from learning programming languages, to developing operating systems and so much more. Today I stumbled upon a book that I'd like to share with you all. I take no credit for any of these ideas, and I am simply trying to help some of the members of this community.
All ideas and concepts belong to their respective owners, I am simply rewording it to keep within the word limit.
EDIT: Instead of actually rewriting the book basically, I'll just post a link to the download:
[url=http://depositfiles.com/en/files/9p91zonsk]Download[/url]
At first it might seem like a lot of reading, but it will certainly help become a better programmer, for those who will accept it.

item.title: 97 Things Every Programmer Should Know
item.dc:creator: @Sun_Chips Sun Chips
item.description:
@Sun_Chips wrote:

This was certainly an interesting read however, I disagree with part of reason 6 bullet 4 where you said,

Thinking you can do a better job is not a valid reason either
I try to be a perfectionist when I program so if I think I can make it more efficient I usually try to.
/feedback

Read full topic
